channel.title: Your most inspiring hacking books
channel.description:
Hey good peeps,
I would like to start a thread on your favorite hacking books. Ones you read recently and taught you one or two new tricks, or ones that you read a decade ago and literally changed your way of thinking about hacking!! I realize there are a lot of "how to hack facebook" shenanigans going on here, so hopefully such a thread will help set people on the right path to hacking... Allow me to start first :
**Books of old that shaped my hacking career (a bit outdated now but still great):** * The Art of Intrusion - The Real Stories Behind the Exploits of Hackers, Intruders and Deceivers , Kevin Mitnick * Counter Hack Reloaded - A Step-by-Step Guide to Computer Attacks and Effective Defenses, Ed Skoudis
**Books that rocked my life recently:** * [How to Hack Like a Legend - A hacker’s tale breaking into a secretive offshore company , Sparc Flow](https://amzn.to/2uWh1Up) * [The Art of Memory Forensics - Detecting Malware and Threats in Windows, Linux, and Mac Memory](https://www.amazon.com/Art-Memory-Forensics-Detecting-Malware/dp/1118825098/)
Your turn :slight_smile:
